intro: Pisum tuffetii, commonly known as the Tuffetii pea, is a rare and ancient legume species native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small, pod-like fruits containing one to two seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its rarity and historical significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
